alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Brunswick County through 245 PM EDT... At 155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Boiling Spring Lakes nearly stationary. This thunderstorm will continue to develop back to the west toward Bolivia over the next 30 minutes. Heavy rain and lightning can be expected with the thunderstorm. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boiling Spring Lakes, Mill Creek, Winnabow and Bolivia. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 30 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
